rationale: The agent added the maven-jar-plugin with test-jar goal (correct core requirement), but introduced several problematic changes. Ground truth uses version 2.3.2 with simple includes; agent uses 2.4 with complex includes/excludes that are overly specific and brittle (hardcoding subpackages like test/engine, test/store, etc., and attempting to include Lucene test classes that shouldn't be packaged). Agent added unnecessary dependencies with 'provided' scope (hamcrest-all, lucene-test-framework, junit4-maven-plugin) - these should already be transitive test dependencies, not declared as provided. Agent changed Java compiler version from 1.6 to 1.8 without justification (not requested). Agent added maven-javadoc-plugin and maven-source-plugin test-jar executions (not requested). The ground truth's simple approach with just 'org/elasticsearch/test/**/*' is more maintainable and correct than the agent's verbose configuration. The core functionality (test-jar goal) is present but the implementation is overcomplicated and includes unrelated changes.
ground_truth_patch:
diff --git a/pom.xml b/pom.xml
index dec5334e526..518164547b6 100644
--- a/pom.xml
+++ b/pom.xml
@@ -975,6 +975,23 @@
                     </arguments>
                 </configuration>
             </plugin>
+            <plugin>
+                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
+                <artifactId>maven-jar-plugin</artifactId>
+                <version>2.3.2</version>
+                <executions>
+                    <execution>
+                        <goals>
+                            <goal>test-jar</goal>
+                        </goals>
+                    </execution>
+                </executions>
+                <configuration>
+                    <includes>
+                        <include>org/elasticsearch/test/**/*</include>
+                    </includes>
+                </configuration>
+            </plugin>
         </plugins>
         <pluginManagement>
             <plugins>
